data.title: most god awful food I have eaten in a while
data.text: Nothing was palatable. The ribs were all bone and very little meat, the brisket was fatty and super tough. The cole slaw was disgusting, the potato salad tasted like it was spoiled, the green beans were too vinegary. Even the peach cobbler was terrible.The wife had a #5 and the bread was still doughy and raw and the chicken was bad, dry and no flavor....

data.title: good local BBQ
data.text: for being a chain bbq place it was worth the money. i would definitely visit again. i was impressed at the service

data.title: It’s well-known in Texas that if you want good fast food barbecue you go to Bill’s
data.text:
One thing you have to try when you come to Bill Miller Bar-B-Q is the smoked brisket and sausage. It’s juicy and flavorful, definitely not what you expect from a fast food joint. Most meals come with beans and slaw on the side but there are other options like French fries. The meat is slathered in a tangy BBQ sauce which you can taste in every bite, AWESOME. If you’re looking for something cheap and delicious this is the place!!

The ambiance of Bill Miller Bar-B-Q is your average fast food chain. There’s plenty of seating and counters, and there is a glass case where you can pick from salads, pie, and more. The staff is friendly and what you’d expect from any chain restaurant.

Good ambiance, good food, nice staff, and cheap cheap CHEAP BBQ Eats!

data.title: Great BBQ
data.text: My favorite part is the rye bread that is served with the BBQ.   You can choose from Beef to chicken & the deserts are delicious.

data.title: Great food!  Service?  Shaun of the Dead.
data.text:
Cream corn?  I'd never thought I'd say this about cream corn, but it was pretty freaking outstanding.  Potato salad was exemplary as well.  The ribs were above average, however a little dry but I was glad the sauce came on the side. 
 That's the good. Now here's the service critique.  

First of all, I have to say, that I was highly amused at my interaction with the person taking my order.  I will just have to go from memory as it happened a few nights ago.  
"Can I help you?
"Yes, I'd like some pork ribs and two sides please."
"So you want a number three?"
""I guess if that's what it is."
Long pause...like 30 seconds.
 "So you want a number three?"
"Uh yes."
 "What sides?"
"Just cream corn and potato salad please"
30 second pause
"It comes with three, so you want double potato salad?"
"Umm sure that's fine."
"And a sweet tea?"
"No thanks, I'd just like regular tea. I'm trying to watch my girlish figure."
Long pause.
"That will be (cost)"
After I pay and leave.  I stick the straw in my cup to take a sip of...sweet tea.

data.title: Pretty good BBQ
data.text: Saw this BBQ place from our hotel so it was a easy walk. The restaurant closes early. I think it closes about 4pm. This location has a bakery that goes all night and appeared the restaurant feeds their employees. They cut your meat in front of you and the employees were all very friendly. Had all the normal BBQ sides. I would eat there again. The prices were very reasonable.  It is cafeteria style with employees filling your plate. It is BBQ meats, sides and rolls only + drinks. Great sweet tea.

data.title: First BBQ in Tx in many yrs
data.text: It was great, and I'm not sure I picked the right bld, but it was right out the main gate of Lackland AFB, the youg girl who waited on us was so polite, I thanked her before we left, food was great, ribs nice and tender

data.title: Not my idea of Bar-B-Q
data.text: We ate here while sight seeing around the Riverwalk area.  Several of us got the pork sandwich and it was horrible!  It was the consistency of sloppy joes.  Maybe we should have tried the brisket, but the pork was awful.  The only thing that was decent was their sweet tea - it was pretty good.

data.title: Good BBQ at a decent price.
data.text: We had dinner here last Friday night while visiting San Antonio. I must say, the smoked meat and fried chicken was pretty good. The pinot beans, green beans and cole-slaw were okay. The only thing I didn't like was the BBQ sauce. Besides that I would recommend stopping here.

data.title: Bad BBQ
data.text: This place is in a bad location to get in and out of. We looked over the menu and got some food to go since we had been driving all day. This place closes at 9, so we had about 15 minutes. The cashier did not greet us and seemed to be in a hurry. We ordered two adult plates with 3 meats and it come with 3 vegetables on each plate. Once we got back to the room, we discovered one of our sides was missing, but they were already closed. The portions were small and the meat evidently is weighed because there wasn't much of any it. There was 2 tiny ribs and 2 half pieces of brisket and 4 thin slices of sausage. The coleslaw and BBQ sauce had way too much vinegar. It was absolutely the worst thing I've ever put in my mouth. The green beans had some type of tomato based dressing in them and they were also bad. The potato salad was soupy. The only thing this place has going for it is the sweet tea. We will not be back or recommend this place to anyone.

data.title: Bar-B-Q - ok, Pecan Pie - AWESOME
data.text: Bar-B-Q is average we don't go there for the Bar-B-Q, however when we are close to one we will always stop in and grab a pecan pie to go. There other desserts are good as well, Pies price very resaonable, always a big hit wherever we take them.

data.title: Good BBQ
data.text:
This location is one of a chain.  Its hours are daytime, M-F to serve the nearby government and office workers.
Place your order at the counter. They dish it, provide your soda [no liquor], take your money and you find a table to eat.  There is a cooler table of condiments if you want to help yourself.  Sit and enjoy.
No tipping needed as there in no "service"

data.title: Good food to for hungry lunch
data.text: A cafeteria style, no frills place with a good selection for a big breakfast. The brisket biscuit was OK and the Cowboy breakfast was good. Fast food for a good price.

data.title: HORRIBLE
data.text: We have never been to san Antonio . We were on a family vacation for sea world. We kept seeing this place everywhere so we were like it had to be good. Boy were we WRONGGG!!! We thought that it was a bbq place so that's what we ordered we all got ribs. So first off it took 30 mins to get our order and we should have known it was a problem when everyone was getting chicken strips. Hmmm ok I thought it was a bbq place ok. So the ribs were sooo tough the kids couldn't even chew them. The beans just were a bland taste no bbq or sweet taste. We should have knew better when we went in and didn't smell bbq smoke smh that was our first mistake. we will never eat here again. Oh and we are from dallas so we know what bbq should taste like.

data.title: Good food but limited hours
data.text: We saw the sign and wanted to give it a try as it was across the street from the hotel we were staying at in San Antonio. We arrived at 4:05pm and the sign said it was only open until 4:00pm, but this was at the main office so we thought it closed that early because that's when the offices closed. The next day we went to another one in the city and arrived at about 3:55pm.  We ordered our meal and started to eat and the manager locked the front doors.  Seems they are only open 9 - 4 / M - F. We were not the only ones in there still eating and the employees didn't have any issue with that.  They were just cleaning up.  The food was good and the fries were great, but because they were cleaning up we couldn't find the ketchup.  We really did liked the BBQ sauce.  It didn't over power the meat. Quite an interesting experience.

data.title: Plenty of food for a modest price
data.text: The restaurant offered a wider menu than just BBQ. Large portions for a reasonable price. You go through a cafeteria style line and seat yourself. The only real negative were the restrooms which literally stunk ... badly.

data.title: Great food on a budget
data.text:
We've had expensive BBQ on the Riverwalk and stumbled on this place while looking at the historic church, San Fernando Cathedral. 

We decided to try it and we're pleasantly surprised. Sort of cafeteria style,  they dish up high portions on plastic plates and it is deeeelish! Highly recommend this place! Just be sure to ask for UNSWEETENED tea unless you want to die from sugar overload!

data.title: Ok BBQ, Good Prices And Tasty Pies
data.text:
For an affordable BBQ lunch Bill Miller is not a bad option. For sure there is better BBQ in San Antonio but for less than $10 for two sandwiches, a side, drink and a slice of a tasty pie I think I got my money's worth.

I found staff at this location to be friendly and the service to be good. I will definitely be back when I am looking for a quick and affordable lunch.

data.title: Don't waste your money
data.text: We stopped by the Bill Miller in Alamo Ranch. The food was cold and had no flavor. We will not be returning to this restaurant again.

data.title: Untrained personnel + poor food = failure.
data.text: I just give up. The people at several, not just one location don't know their own menu. This time my wife went to NW Military location and told them she wanted 6 pieces of JUST chicken. The cashier said, so you want the No. 2. Wife said no, I just want 6 pieces of chicken, mixed darkened white. Cashier said great. Then someone comes from the back with a bag and says 2 No.2's and it was $11 plus change. For 6 pieces of chicken?  No, for 2 No. 2s.....wife gave up, came home and guess what?  No dark meat. So, she did't get want she ordered, paid for a dry roll and greasy, soggy french fries and none of she ordered.  On top of that it was THE greasiest chicken ever. Bill Miller is awful making BBQ and now can't even make good fried chicken.  What a mess. Never going back.
